message.content:
cs.CL, cs.IR, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.DS

This paper discusses a multi-document summarizer that uses topic detection and tracking, which is a common technique in natural language processing (NLP) and information retrieval (IR) research. The paper also introduces new techniques for evaluating single and multiple document summaries. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.CL (Computation and Language), which includes research on NLP and summarization. 

The paper also mentions the use of machine learning techniques, such as clustering and subsumption, which are common in artificial intelligence (AI) and machine learning (ML) research. Therefore, cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) is also a likely sub-category. 

The evaluation techniques mentioned in the paper involve measuring the utility of individual sentences, which is a common approach in IR research. Therefore, cs.IR (Information Retrieval) is another likely sub-category. 

The paper also describes user studies, which involve human-computer interaction and user experience, making cs.HC (Human-Computer Interaction) a possible sub-category. 

Finally, the paper mentions the use of clustering, which is a common technique in data science and machine learning research. Therefore, cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms) is also a possible sub-category.
